messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:11): Is WebKit planning on implementing MathML in the foreseeable future?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:11): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: there's an implementation in progress
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:11): Oh, awesome.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:11): it's off by default in the builds right now though
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:11): We were just talking about math rendering in #mediawiki.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:12): So it will be a typical all-but-IE thing.  Probably it would make sense to skip straight to MathML and not try intermediate solutions like jsMath, in that case.
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: are volume and muted attributes of <video> that can be used by authors?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:22): i.e. can they be used as in <video volume="0.5" muted> or are they just javascript interfaces?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:22): JS
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:22): not sure what it would mean to have them be content attributes
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:22): ah cool - defaultPlaybackRate is a content attribute though?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:23): well, it would mean to start a video muted and with a specific volume setting - but I am only documenting it, not wanting to introduce anything
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:28): Content attributes are listed here: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/video.html#video
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (04:29): Global attributes, src, poster, preload, autoplay, loop, controls, width, height, that's it.
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:46): but the way that I read defaultPlaybackRate it is also a content attribute
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:46): that's what's been confusing me
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:48): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/video.html#loading-the-media-resource says
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:48): "Set the playbackRate attribute to the value of the defaultPlaybackRate attribute."
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:49): in the media element loading algorithm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): should i ignore dynamic changes to <track src> made after the track has loaded?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): or should i support unloading a track and reloading it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): what's the use case?
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:52): what's the harm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:52): it's a big implementation and specification burden
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:52): 'because it's hard' is generally not an acceptable 'excuse'
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:52): sure it is
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:53): it's probably the main reason for not doing things
2d039717f89d95c099d4d07556c54371 (04:53): I don't like doing things unless they are hard
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:53): do we allow it for videos?
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:53): so it's okay to do web dev with nested tables, because it's 'easy' ?
2d039717f89d95c099d4d07556c54371 (04:54): nested tables made me millions
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:54): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: it's easier to use semantic markup than tables
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:54): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: so i don't buy that
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:54): I agree, but new developers don't view it as such

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:54): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: but generally speaking, there are often cases where there are other even more important reasons to do something that override the "it's hard" reason not to do it
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:54): I think since we do it for videos, it would be inconsistent not to allow it for <track>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:55): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: the question is here, what's the reason for doing it that overrides the reason not to do it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:55): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: we don't do it for <source>
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:55): but for <video src> ?
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I don't have a use-case, but I am sure that it would be greatly appreciated by developers to implement
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:56): yes, for <video> src we do it, but there's a good reason to support that (how else would you change the video?)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:56): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: i'm having trouble imagining when a dev would ever do it
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:56): if somebody changes the video's src half way through via JS, they would surely also need to change the <track src> that relate to that video
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:56): surely they'd just blow away the <track>s and insert entirely new ones
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:56): not mutate the existing ones
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:57): just like with <source>
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:57): yeah, I think that's fair enough
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:57): i guess we can always change it later
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:57): if there's a use case

040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:58): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I am writing a book on html5 video and am currently documenting content attributes - is defaultPlaybackRate a content attribute?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): the list of content attributes is in the spec in several places
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): e.g. in the green box in the element's definition
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): under "Content attributes:"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): or in the index at the bottom of the spec
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (04:59): Ian, As a developer, I would be annoyed if I was required to destroy and create a new <track>, however I was able to just mutate a <video>
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (04:59): yeah, but that confuses me with the defaultPlaybackRate, since it would make sense to set it as content attribute and then use only playbackRate in JS
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (05:00): plus as 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 pointed out, it's inconsistent
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:00): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: defaultPlaybackRate is the rate of playback, playbackRate is the rate you'd use when ffwding or rewinding
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (05:00): it's as inconsistent as the <source> elements are
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:00): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: well, if we do support it... what happens to the TimedTrackCue objects?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:01): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: seems weird that we'd suddenly orphan all those objects...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:01): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: i can't think of any time we do that currently
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:01): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: would their .track be reset so you could insert them into an API-created timed track? that'd be even weirder...

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:02): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: there's lots of cases where we don't react to changes like this, btw, e.g. if you change the <base href=""> base URL, we don't reload anything dynamically
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (05:02): I'm not familiar with those objects, reference literature?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:02): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: even though technically all the URLs in the doc changed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:02): e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d: they're the new ones for the timed track API
e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (05:02): ack! enter spam :|
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:04): btw, should i name these interfaces MediaTrack/MediaCue or TimedTrack/TimedTrackCue ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:04): hm, gotta go for dinner, bbl to continue!
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (05:05): does a change to <video src> blow away all the <source> elements?
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (05:06): I like MediaTrack/MediaCue

e0563cc2e83070e74ce7019226dd654d (05:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: After reading through the spec, I think it would be easier to just remove and recreate the <track>, both from a developer stand point, as well as UI implementation
